Satgas Bencana Bagikan Ribuan Jeriken Air di Sumenep
05 Nov 2019, 16:41 by Diskoinfo Jatim, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Satgas Penanggulangan Bencana Kekeringan tiba di Pulau Sapudi, Sumenep untuk menyerahkan bantuan bagi warga Kepulauan Sumenep yang mengalami krisis air bersih. (Foto: Dok. Diskominfo Jatim)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Satgas Penanggulangan Bencana Kekeringan menyerahkan bantuan air bersih bagi warga Kepulauan Sumenep yang hingga kini masih mengalami kekeringan. Kapal yang memuat bantuan itu bersandar di Dermaga Tarebung Pulau Sapudi, Sumenep, Jawa Timur.Komandan Satfib Koarmada II sekaligus Dansatgas Penanggulangan Bencana Kekeringan di Sumenep Teguh Iman Wibowo yang tengah melaksanakan survei dan cek lokasi membenarkan bahwa bantuan air bersih yang berasal dari Gubernur Jawa Timur itu dilaksanakan hari ini, Selasa (5/11). "Gubernur Jatim didampingi Pangkoarmda II serta Danlantamal V menyerahkan secara simbolis bantuan air bersih bagi warga Pulau Sapudi, Giligenting, dan Kangean," ujar Teguh melalui keterangannya, Senin (4/11). Tercatat tiga pulau menjadi sasaran pemberian bantuan air bersih yakni Pulau Sapudi meliputi Kecamatan Gayam dan Nonggunong. Kemudian Pulau Giligenting meliputi Kecamatan Giligenting dan Pulau Kangean meliputi Kecamatan Arjasa dan Kangayan. Bantuan yang diberikan kurang lebih sebanyak 3.000-5.000 jeriken air bersih, tiap jeriken berisi 25 liter. Selain itu, terdapat 3 mobil tangki air BPBD Jatim yang masing-masing mengangkut 5 ton air ikut mendukung program bantuan air bersih ini. Bantuan PersonelSementara, untuk dukungan personel berjumlah kurang lebih 200 orang, terdiri atas Satgas Gabungan Armada, Lantamal V dan Lanal Batuporon. Kemudian 1 SST Yonmarhanlan, BPBD Jatim, Tagana dan Satpol PP.Satgas tersebut, lanjut Teguh, dibentuk atas kepedulian pimpinan Pangkoarmada II Laksda TNI Heru Kusmanto terhadap kondisi warga di Pulau Sapudi. "Sesuai perintah Pangkoarmada II maka kita siapkan material dan personel sebagai Satgas Penanggulangan Bencana Kekeringan di Pulau Sapudi, yang bersinergi dengan BPBD Jatim, Satpol PP, dan Polri yang akan bertugas dari tanggal 3 hingga 6 November 2019." Diketahui, selain KRI Teluk Ende, Pangkalan Utama TNI AL V (Lantamal V) juga mengerahkan dua yakni kapal TD Tambora dan TD Bromo untuk mengangkut tongkang berisi 250 ton air bersih untuk didistribusikan kepada masyarakat di daerah tersebut. Keduanya yang berukuran kecil akan berkeliling ke beberapa pulau lain untuk bantu distribusi air bersih, sedangkan KRI Teluk Ende yang juga membawa bantuan logistik tetap di Pulau Sapudi.

Disaster Task Force Distributes Thousands of Jeriken Water in Sumenep
05 Nov 2019, 16:41 by East Java Diskoinfo, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


The Drought Disaster Management Task Force arrived at Sapudi Island, Sumenep to hand over aid to residents of the Sumenep Islands who are experiencing a clean water crisis. (Photo: Doc. Of East Java Diskominfo)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - Drought Disaster Management Task Force hands over clean water assistance to residents of the Sumenep Islands who are still experiencing drought. The ship containing the aid was leaning on Tarebung Pier, Sapudi Island, Sumenep, East Java. The Commander of Satfib Koarmada II as well as the Dansatgas for Drought Disaster Management in Sumenep Teguh Iman Wibowo who was conducting a survey and site check confirmed that the clean water assistance from the Governor of East Java was held today, Tuesday (5/11). "East Java Governor accompanied by Pangkoarmda II and Danlantamal V symbolically handed over clean water assistance to residents of Sapudi, Giligenting and Kangean Islands," Teguh said through his statement, Monday (11/4). Three islands were recorded as targets for clean water assistance, namely Sapudi Island, covering the Districts of Gayam and Nonggunong. Then Giligenting Island covers Giligenting District and Kangean Island covers Arjasa and Kangayan Districts. The assistance provided is approximately 3,000-5,000 jerry cans of clean water, each jerry can contains 25 liters. In addition, there are 3 East Java BPBD water tankers, each carrying 5 tons of water, supporting this clean water assistance program. Personnel Assistance Meanwhile, for the support of personnel numbering approximately 200 people, consisting of the Joint Task Force Armada, Lantamal V and Lanal Batuporon. Then 1 SST Yonmarhanlan, East Java BPBD, Tagana and Satpol PP. The Satgas, Teguh continued, was formed with the concern of the leader of the Pangkoarmada II Laksda TNI Heru Kusmanto about the condition of residents on Sapudi Island. "In accordance with Pangkoarmada II's command, we are preparing materials and personnel as the Drought Disaster Management Task Force on Sapudi Island, which synergizes with the East Java BPBD, Satpol PP, and the National Police who will be on duty from November 3 to 6, 2019." It is known, in addition to the KRI of Ende Bay, the Navy Base Base V (Lantamal V) also deployed two vessels, namely TD Tambora and TD Bromo to transport barges containing 250 tons of clean water to be distributed to the people in the area. The two small ones will go around to several other islands to help distribute clean water, while the KRI of Teluk Ende, which also carries logistical assistance, remains on Sapudi Island.
